intro: Anthocleista micrantha, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
